result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Erin L Donovan was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.  

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status.  The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

The court does not oppose a transfer to a jail convenient to the defendants place of employment or residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erin L Donovan

records.addlTxt: Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing
Disposition Form

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Robert P Olmr.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Court reviews amended criminal complaint with the defendant; Defendant waives reading; Court finds probable cause on the charges in the amended complaint.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing; Colloquy w/ Defendant; Court accepts waiver and binds defendant over for trial.  State files Information and same reviewed w/ defendant;  Court takes judicial notices of 14CM753.  On a plea to Ct. 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2;   Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1; Defendant admits to three prior convictions; Court accepts plea, finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1, on motion of the state, Court dismisses Ct. 2 for read in. Joint recommendation; Argument from State, Counsel; Statements from Defendant.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
